00053 /** This is a small utility structure that records information related to one
00054     level of nested control flow.  It's mostly used in correctly restoring
00055     the mask and other state as we exit control flow nesting levels. 
00056 */
00057 struct CFInfo {
00058     /** Returns a new instance of the structure that represents entering an
00059         'if' statement */
00060     static CFInfo *GetIf(bool isUniform, llvm::Value *savedMask);
00061 
00062     /** Returns a new instance of the structure that represents entering a
00063         loop. */
00064     static CFInfo *GetLoop(bool isUniform, llvm::BasicBlock *breakTarget,
00065                            llvm::BasicBlock *continueTarget, 
00066                            llvm::Value *savedBreakLanesPtr,
00067                            llvm::Value *savedContinueLanesPtr,
00068                            llvm::Value *savedMask, llvm::Value *savedLoopMask);
00069 
00070     bool IsIf() { return type == If; }
00071     bool IsLoop() { return type == Loop; }
00072     bool IsVaryingType() { return !isUniform; }
00073     bool IsUniform() { return isUniform; }
00074 
00075     enum CFType { If, Loop };
00076     CFType type;
00077     bool isUniform;
00078     llvm::BasicBlock *savedBreakTarget, *savedContinueTarget;
00079     llvm::Value *savedBreakLanesPtr, *savedContinueLanesPtr;
00080     llvm::Value *savedMask, *savedLoopMask;
00081 
00082 private:
00083     CFInfo(CFType t, bool uniformIf, llvm::Value *sm) {
00084         assert(t == If);
00085         type = t;
00086         isUniform = uniformIf;
00087         savedBreakTarget = savedContinueTarget = NULL;
00088         savedBreakLanesPtr = savedContinueLanesPtr = NULL;
00089         savedMask = savedLoopMask = sm;
00090     }
00091     CFInfo(CFType t, bool iu, llvm::BasicBlock *bt, llvm::BasicBlock *ct,
00092            llvm::Value *sb, llvm::Value *sc, llvm::Value *sm,
00093            llvm::Value *lm) {
00094         assert(t == Loop);
00095         type = t;
00096         isUniform = iu;
00097         savedBreakTarget = bt;
00098         savedContinueTarget = ct;
00099         savedBreakLanesPtr = sb;
00100         savedContinueLanesPtr = sc;
00101         savedMask = sm;
00102         savedLoopMask = lm;
00103     }
00104 };
00105 
00106 
00107 CFInfo *
00108 CFInfo::GetIf(bool isUniform, llvm::Value *savedMask) {
00109     return new CFInfo(If, isUniform, savedMask);
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 CFInfo *
00114 CFInfo::GetLoop(bool isUniform, llvm::BasicBlock *breakTarget,
00115                 llvm::BasicBlock *continueTarget, 
00116                 llvm::Value *savedBreakLanesPtr,
00117                 llvm::Value *savedContinueLanesPtr,
00118                 llvm::Value *savedMask, llvm::Value *savedLoopMask) {
00119     return new CFInfo(Loop, isUniform, breakTarget, continueTarget,
00120                       savedBreakLanesPtr, savedContinueLanesPtr,
00121                       savedMask, savedLoopMask);
00122 }

00126 FunctionEmitContext::FunctionEmitContext(const Type *rt, llvm::Function *function,
00127                                          Symbol *funSym, SourcePos firstStmtPos) {
00128     /* Create a new basic block to store all of the allocas */
00129     allocaBlock = llvm::BasicBlock::Create(*g->ctx, "allocas", function, 0);
00130     bblock = llvm::BasicBlock::Create(*g->ctx, "entry", function, 0);
00131     /* But jump from it immediately into the real entry block */
00132     llvm::BranchInst::Create(bblock, allocaBlock);
00133 
00134     maskPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "mask_memory");
00135     StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOn, maskPtr);
00136 
00137     funcStartPos = funSym->pos;
00138     returnType = rt;
00139     entryMask = NULL;
00140     loopMask = NULL;
00141     breakLanesPtr = continueLanesPtr = NULL;
00142     breakTarget = continueTarget = NULL;
00143 
00144     returnedLanesPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "returned_lanes_memory");
00145     StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, returnedLanesPtr);
00146 
00147     if (!returnType || returnType == AtomicType::Void)
00148         returnValuePtr = NULL;
00149     else {
00150         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ftype = returnType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
00151         returnValuePtr = AllocaInst(ftype, "return_value_memory");
00152         // FIXME: don't do this store???
00153         StoreInst(llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ftype), returnValuePtr);
00154     }
00155 
00156     if (m->diBuilder) {
00157         /* If debugging is enabled, tell the debug information emission
00158            code about this new function */
00159         diFile = funcStartPos.GetDIFile();
00160         llvm::DIType retType = rt->GetDIType(diFile);
00161         int flags = llvm::DIDescriptor::FlagPrototyped; // ??
00162         diFunction = m->diBuilder->createFunction(diFile, /* scope */
00163                                                   function->getName(), // mangled
00164                                                   funSym->name,
00165                                                   diFile,
00166                                                   funcStartPos.first_line,
00167                                                   retType,
00168                                                   funSym->isStatic,
00169                                                   true, /* is definition */
00170                                                   flags,
00171                                                   g->opt.level > 0,
00172                                                   function);
00173         /* And start a scope representing the initial function scope */
00174         StartScope();
00175     }
00176 
00177     launchedTasks = false;
00178 
00179     // connect the funciton's mask memory to the __mask symbol
00180     Symbol *maskSymbol = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("__mask");
00181     assert(maskSymbol != NULL);
00182     maskSymbol->storagePtr = maskPtr;
00183 
00184     // add debugging info for __mask, programIndex, ...
00185     if (m->diBuilder) {
00186         maskSymbol->pos = funcStartPos;
00187         EmitVariableDebugInfo(maskSymbol);
00188 
00189         llvm::DIFile file = funcStartPos.GetDIFile();
00190         Symbol *programIndexSymbol = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("programIndex");
00191         assert(programIndexSymbol && programIndexSymbol->storagePtr);
00192         m->diBuilder->createGlobalVariable(programIndexSymbol->name, 
00193                                            file,
00194                                            funcStartPos.first_line,
00195                                            programIndexSymbol->type->GetDIType(file),
00196                                            true /* static */,
00197                                            programIndexSymbol->storagePtr);
00198 
00199         Symbol *programCountSymbol = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable("programCount");
00200         assert(programCountSymbol);
00201         m->diBuilder->createGlobalVariable(programCountSymbol->name, 
00202                                            file,
00203                                            funcStartPos.first_line,
00204                                            programCountSymbol->type->GetDIType(file),
00205                                            true /* static */,
00206                                            programCountSymbol->storagePtr);
00207     }
00208 }

00211 FunctionEmitContext::~FunctionEmitContext() {
00212     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() == 0);
00213     assert(debugScopes.size() == (m->diBuilder ? 1 : 0));
00214 }

00249 FunctionEmitContext::SetMask(llvm::Value *value) {

00254 void
00255 FunctionEmitContext::MaskAnd(llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *test) {
00256     llvm::Value *mask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, oldMask, 
00257                                        test, "oldMask&test");
00258     SetMask(mask);
00259 }
00260 
00261 
00262 void
00263 FunctionEmitContext::MaskAndNot(llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *test) {
00264     llvm::Value *notTest = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Xor, test, LLVMMaskAllOn,
00265                                           "~test");
00266     llvm::Value *mask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, oldMask, notTest,
00267                                        "oldMask&~test");
00268     SetMask(mask);
00269 }

00272 void
00273 FunctionEmitContext::BranchIfMaskAny(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse) {
00274     assert(bblock != NULL);
00275     llvm::Value *any = Any(GetMask());
00276     BranchInst(btrue, bfalse, any);
00277     // It's illegal to add any additional instructions to the basic block
00278     // now that it's terminated, so set bblock to NULL to be safe
00279     bblock = NULL;
00280 }

00283 void
00284 FunctionEmitContext::BranchIfMaskAll(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse) {
00285     assert(bblock != NULL);
00286     llvm::Value *all = All(GetMask());
00287     BranchInst(btrue, bfalse, all);
00288     // It's illegal to add any additional instructions to the basic block
00289     // now that it's terminated, so set bblock to NULL to be safe
00290     bblock = NULL;
00291 }

00294 void
00295 FunctionEmitContext::BranchIfMaskNone(llvm::BasicBlock *btrue, llvm::BasicBlock *bfalse) {
00296     assert(bblock != NULL);
00297     // switch sense of true/false bblocks
00298     BranchIfMaskAny(bfalse, btrue);
00299     // It's illegal to add any additional instructions to the basic block
00300     // now that it's terminated, so set bblock to NULL to be safe
00301     bblock = NULL;
00302 }

00311 void
00312 FunctionEmitContext::StartVaryingIf(llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00313     controlFlowInfo.push_back(CFInfo::GetIf(false, oldMask));

00316 
00317 void
00318 FunctionEmitContext::EndIf() {
00319     // Make sure we match up with a Start{Uniform,Varying}If().
00320     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() > 0 && controlFlowInfo.back()->IsIf());
00321     CFInfo *ci = controlFlowInfo.back();
00322     controlFlowInfo.pop_back();
00323 
00324     // 'uniform' ifs don't change the mask so we only need to restore the
00325     // mask going into the if for 'varying' if statements
00326     if (!ci->IsUniform() && bblock != NULL) {
00327         // We can't just restore the mask as it was going into the 'if'
00328         // statement.  First we have to take into account any program
00329         // instances that have executed 'return' statements; the restored
00330         // mask must be off for those lanes.
00331         restoreMaskGivenReturns(ci->savedMask);
00332 
00333         // If the 'if' statement is inside a loop with a 'varying'
00334         // consdition, we also need to account for any break or continue
00335         // statements that executed inside the 'if' statmeent; we also must
00336         // leave the lane masks for the program instances that ran those
00337         // off after we restore the mask after the 'if'.  The code below
00338         // ends up being optimized out in the case that there were no break
00339         // or continue statements (and breakLanesPtr and continueLanesPtr
00340         // have their initial 'all off' values), so we don't need to check
00341         // for that here.
00342         if (breakLanesPtr != NULL) {
00343             assert(continueLanesPtr != NULL);
00344 
00345             // newMask = (oldMask & ~(breakLanes | continueLanes))
00346             llvm::Value *oldMask = GetMask();
00347             llvm::Value *breakLanes = LoadInst(breakLanesPtr, NULL, 
00348                                                "break_lanes");
00349             llvm::Value *continueLanes = LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, 
00350                                                   "continue_lanes");
00351             llvm::Value *breakOrContinueLanes = 
00352                 BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, breakLanes, continueLanes,
00353                                "break|continue_lanes");
00354             llvm::Value *notBreakOrContinue = NotOperator(breakOrContinueLanes,
00355                                                           "!(break|continue)_lanes");
00356             llvm::Value *newMask = 
00357                 BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, oldMask, notBreakOrContinue, 
00358                                "new_mask");
00359             SetMask(newMask);
00360         }
00361     }
00362 }
00363 
00364 
00365 void
00366 FunctionEmitContext::StartLoop(llvm::BasicBlock *bt, llvm::BasicBlock *ct, 
00367                                bool uniformCF, llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00368     // Store the current values of various loop-related state so that we
00369     // can restore it when we exit this loop.
00370     controlFlowInfo.push_back(CFInfo::GetLoop(uniformCF, breakTarget, 
00371                                               continueTarget, breakLanesPtr,
00372                                               continueLanesPtr, oldMask, loopMask));
00373     if (uniformCF)
00374         // If the loop has a uniform condition, we don't need to track
00375         // which lanes 'break' or 'continue'; all of the running ones go
00376         // together, so we just jump
00377         breakLanesPtr = continueLanesPtr = NULL;
00378     else {
00379         // For loops with varying conditions, allocate space to store masks
00380         // that record which lanes have done these
00381         continueLanesPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "continue_lanes_memory");
00382         StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, continueLanesPtr);
00383         breakLanesPtr = AllocaInst(LLVMTypes::MaskType, "break_lanes_memory");
00384         StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, breakLanesPtr);
00385     }
00386 
00387     breakTarget = bt;
00388     continueTarget = ct;
00389     loopMask = NULL; // this better be set by the loop!
00390 }
00391 
00392 
00393 void
00394 FunctionEmitContext::EndLoop() {
00395     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() && !controlFlowInfo.back()->IsIf());
00396     CFInfo *ci = controlFlowInfo.back();
00397     controlFlowInfo.pop_back();
00398 
00399     // Restore the break/continue state information to what it was before
00400     // we went into this loop.
00401     breakTarget = ci->savedBreakTarget;
00402     continueTarget = ci->savedContinueTarget;
00403     breakLanesPtr = ci->savedBreakLanesPtr;
00404     continueLanesPtr = ci->savedContinueLanesPtr;
00405     loopMask = ci->savedLoopMask;
00406 
00407     if (!ci->IsUniform())
00408         // If the loop had a 'uniform' test, then it didn't make any
00409         // changes to the mask so there's nothing to restore.  If it had a
00410         // varying test, we need to restore the mask to what it was going
00411         // into the loop, but still leaving off any lanes that executed a
00412         // 'return' statement.
00413         restoreMaskGivenReturns(ci->savedMask);
00414 }
00415 
00416 
00417 void
00418 FunctionEmitContext::restoreMaskGivenReturns(llvm::Value *oldMask) {
00419     if (!bblock)
00420         return;
00421 
00422     // Restore the mask to the given old mask, but leave off any lanes that
00423     // executed a return statement.
00424     // newMask = (oldMask & ~returnedLanes)
00425     llvm::Value *returnedLanes = LoadInst(returnedLanesPtr, NULL, "returned_lanes");
00426     llvm::Value *notReturned = NotOperator(returnedLanes, "~returned_lanes");
00427     llvm::Value *newMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And,
00428                                           oldMask, notReturned, "new_mask");
00429     SetMask(newMask);
00430 }
00431 
00432 
00433 void
00434 FunctionEmitContext::Break(bool doCoherenceCheck) {
00435     if (breakTarget == NULL) {
00436         Error(currentPos, "\"break\" statement is illegal outside of for/while/do loops.");
00437         return;
00438     }
00439 
00440     // If all of the enclosing 'if' tests in the loop have uniform control
00441     // flow or if we can tell that the mask is all on, then we can just
00442     // jump to the break location.
00443     if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() || GetMask() == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00444         BranchInst(breakTarget);
00445         if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() && doCoherenceCheck)
00446             Warning(currentPos, "Coherent break statement not necessary in fully uniform "
00447                     "control flow.");
00448         // Set bblock to NULL since the jump has terminated the basic block
00449         bblock = NULL;
00450     }
00451     else {
00452         // Otherwise we need to update the mask of the lanes that have
00453         // executed a 'break' statement:
00454         // breakLanes = breakLanes | mask
00455         assert(breakLanesPtr != NULL);
00456         llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
00457         llvm::Value *breakMask = LoadInst(breakLanesPtr, NULL, "break_mask");
00458         llvm::Value *newMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or,
00459                                               mask, breakMask, "mask|break_mask");
00460         StoreInst(newMask, breakLanesPtr);
00461 
00462         // Set the current mask to be all off, just in case there are any
00463         // statements in the same scope after the 'break'.  Most of time
00464         // this will be optimized away since we'll likely end the scope of
00465         // an 'if' statement and restore the mask then.
00466         SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOff);
00467 
00468         if (doCoherenceCheck)
00469             // If the user has indicated that this is a 'coherent' break
00470             // statement, then check to see if the mask is all off.  If so,
00471             // we have to conservatively jump to the continueTarget, not
00472             // the breakTarget, since part of the reason the mask is all
00473             // off may be due to 'continue' statements that executed in the
00474             // current loop iteration.  
00475             // FIXME: if the loop only has break statements and no
00476             // continues, we can jump to breakTarget in that case.
00477             jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(continueTarget);
00478     }
00479 }
00480 
00481 
00482 void
00483 FunctionEmitContext::Continue(bool doCoherenceCheck) {
00484     if (!continueTarget) {
00485         Error(currentPos, "\"continue\" statement illegal outside of for/while/do loops.");
00486         return;
00487     }
00488 
00489     if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() || GetMask() == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
00490         // Similarly to 'break' statements, we can immediately jump to the
00491         // continue target if we're only in 'uniform' control flow within
00492         // loop or if we can tell that the mask is all on.
00493         AddInstrumentationPoint("continue: uniform CF, jumped");
00494         if (ifsInLoopAllUniform() && doCoherenceCheck)
00495             Warning(currentPos, "Coherent continue statement not necessary in fully uniform "
00496                     "control flow.");
00497         BranchInst(continueTarget);
00498         bblock = NULL;
00499     }
00500     else {
00501         // Otherwise update the stored value of which lanes have 'continue'd.
00502         // continueLanes = continueLanes | mask
00503         assert(continueLanesPtr);
00504         llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
00505         llvm::Value *continueMask = 
00506             LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, "continue_mask");
00507         llvm::Value *newMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or,
00508                                               mask, continueMask, "mask|continueMask");
00509         StoreInst(newMask, continueLanesPtr);
00510 
00511         // And set the current mask to be all off in case there are any
00512         // statements in the same scope after the 'continue'
00513         SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOff);
00514 
00515         if (doCoherenceCheck) 
00516             // If this is a 'coherent continue' statement, then emit the
00517             // code to see if all of the lanes are now off due to
00518             // breaks/continues and jump to the continue target if so.
00519             jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(continueTarget);
00520     }
00521 }
00522 
00523 
00524 /** This function checks to see if all of the 'if' statements (if any)
00525     between the current scope and the first enclosing loop have 'uniform'
00526     tests.
00527  */
00528 bool
00529 FunctionEmitContext::ifsInLoopAllUniform() const {
00530     assert(controlFlowInfo.size() > 0);
00531     // Go backwards through controlFlowInfo, since we add new nested scopes
00532     // to the back.  Stop once we come to the first enclosing loop.
00533     int i = controlFlowInfo.size() - 1;
00534     while (i >= 0 && controlFlowInfo[i]->type != CFInfo::Loop) {
00535         if (controlFlowInfo[i]->isUniform == false)
00536             // Found a scope due to an 'if' statement with a varying test
00537             return false;
00538         --i;
00539     }
00540     assert(i >= 0); // else we didn't find a loop!
00541     return true;
00542 }
00543 
00544 
00545 void
00546 FunctionEmitContext::jumpIfAllLoopLanesAreDone(llvm::BasicBlock *target) {
00547     // Check to see if (returned lanes | continued lanes | break lanes) is
00548     // equal to the value of mask at the start of the loop iteration.  If
00549     // so, everyone is done and we can jump to the given target
00550     llvm::Value *returned = LoadInst(returnedLanesPtr, NULL, "returned_lanes");
00551     llvm::Value *continued = LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, "continue_lanes");
00552     llvm::Value *breaked = LoadInst(breakLanesPtr, NULL, "break_lanes");
00553     llvm::Value *returnedOrContinued = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, 
00554                                                       returned, continued,
00555                                                       "returned|continued");
00556     llvm::Value *returnedOrContinuedOrBreaked = 
00557         BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, returnedOrContinued,
00558                        breaked, "returned|continued");
00559 
00560     // Do we match the mask at loop entry?
00561     llvm::Value *allRCB = MasksAllEqual(returnedOrContinuedOrBreaked, loopMask);
00562     llvm::BasicBlock *bAll = CreateBasicBlock("all_continued_or_breaked");
00563     llvm::BasicBlock *bNotAll = CreateBasicBlock("not_all_continued_or_breaked");
00564     BranchInst(bAll, bNotAll, allRCB);
00565 
00566     // If so, have an extra basic block along the way to add
00567     // instrumentation, if the user asked for it.
00568     bblock = bAll;
00569     AddInstrumentationPoint("break/continue: all dynamically went");
00570     BranchInst(target);
00571 
00572     // And set the current basic block to a new one for future instructions
00573     // for the path where we weren't able to jump
00574     bblock = bNotAll;
00575     AddInstrumentationPoint("break/continue: not all went");
00576 }
00577 
00578 
00579 void
00580 FunctionEmitContext::RestoreContinuedLanes() {
00581     if (continueLanesPtr == NULL)
00582         return;
00583 
00584     // mask = mask & continueFlags
00585     llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
00586     llvm::Value *continueMask = LoadInst(continueLanesPtr, NULL, "continue_mask");
00587     llvm::Value *orMask = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or,
00588                                          mask, continueMask, "mask|continue_mask");
00589     SetMask(orMask);
00590 
00591     // continueLanes = 0
00592     StoreInst(LLVMMaskAllOff, continueLanesPtr);
00593 }
00594 
00595 
00596 int
00597 FunctionEmitContext::VaryingCFDepth() const { 
00598     int sum = 0;
00599     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < controlFlowInfo.size(); ++i)
00600         if (controlFlowInfo[i]->IsVaryingType())
00601             ++sum;
00602     return sum;
00603 }
00604 
00605 
00606 void
00607 FunctionEmitContext::CurrentLanesReturned(Expr *expr, bool doCoherenceCheck) {
00608     if (returnType == AtomicType::Void) {
00609         if (expr != NULL)
00610             Error(expr->pos, "Can't return non-void type \"%s\" from void function.",
00611                   expr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
00612     }
00613     else {
00614         if (expr == NULL) {
00615             Error(funcStartPos,
00616                   "Must provide return value for return statement for non-void function.");
00617             return;
00618         }
00619         
00620         // Use a masked store to store the value of the expression in the
00621         // return value memory; this preserves the return values from other
00622         // lanes that may have executed return statements previously.
00623         Expr *r = expr->TypeConv(returnType, "return statement");
00624         if (r != NULL) {
00625             llvm::Value *retVal = r->GetValue(this);
00626             StoreInst(retVal, returnValuePtr, GetMask(), returnType);
00627         }
00628     }
00629 
00630     if (VaryingCFDepth() == 0) {
00631         // If there is only uniform control flow between us and the
00632         // function entry, then it's guaranteed that all lanes are running,
00633         // so we can just emit a true return instruction
00634         AddInstrumentationPoint("return: uniform control flow");
00635         ReturnInst();
00636     }
00637     else {
00638         // Otherwise we update the returnedLanes value by ANDing it with
00639         // the current lane mask.
00640         llvm::Value *oldReturnedLanes = LoadInst(returnedLanesPtr, NULL,
00641                                                  "old_returned_lanes");
00642         llvm::Value *newReturnedLanes = BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, 
00643                                                        oldReturnedLanes, 
00644                                                        GetMask(), "old_mask|returned_lanes");
00645         
00646         // For 'coherent' return statements, emit code to check if all
00647         // lanes have returned
00648         if (doCoherenceCheck) {
00649             // if newReturnedLanes == entryMask, get out of here!
00650             llvm::Value *cmp = MasksAllEqual(entryMask, newReturnedLanes);
00651             llvm::BasicBlock *bDoReturn = CreateBasicBlock("do_return");
00652             llvm::BasicBlock *bNoReturn = CreateBasicBlock("no_return");
00653             BranchInst(bDoReturn, bNoReturn, cmp);
00654 
00655             bblock = bDoReturn;
00656             AddInstrumentationPoint("return: all lanes have returned");
00657             ReturnInst();
00658 
00659             bblock = bNoReturn;
00660         }
00661         // Otherwise update returnedLanesPtr and turn off all of the lanes
00662         // in the current mask so that any subsequent statements in the
00663         // same scope after the return have no effect
00664         StoreInst(newReturnedLanes, returnedLanesPtr);
00665         AddInstrumentationPoint("return: some but not all lanes have returned");
00666         SetMask(LLVMMaskAllOff);
00667     }
00668 }
00669 
00670 
00671 llvm::Value *
00672 FunctionEmitContext::Any(llvm::Value *mask) {
00673     llvm::Value *mmval = LaneMask(mask);
00674     return CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE, mmval,
00675                    LLVMInt32(0), "any_mm_cmp");
00676 }
00677 
00678 
00679 llvm::Value *
00680 FunctionEmitContext::All(llvm::Value *mask) {
00681     llvm::Value *mmval = LaneMask(mask);
00682     return CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ, mmval,
00683                    LLVMInt32((1<<g->target.vectorWidth)-1), "all_mm_cmp");
00684 }
00685 
00686 
00687 llvm::Value *
00688 FunctionEmitContext::LaneMask(llvm::Value *v) {
00689     // Call the target-dependent movmsk function to turn the vector mask
00690     // into an i32 value
00691     std::vector<Symbol *> *mm = m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("__movmsk");
00692     // There should be one with signed int signature, one unsigned int.
00693     assert(mm && mm->size() == 2); 
00694     llvm::Function *fmm = (*mm)[0]->function;
00695     return CallInst(fmm, v, "val_movmsk");
00696 }
00697 
00698 
00699 llvm::Value *
00700 FunctionEmitContext::MasksAllEqual(llvm::Value *v1, llvm::Value *v2) {
00701 #if 0
00702     // Compare the two masks to get a vector of i1s
00703     llvm::Value *cmp = CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
00704                                v1, v2, "v1==v2");
00705     // Turn that into a bool vector type (often i32s)
00706     cmp = I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
00707     // And see if it's all on
00708     return All(cmp);
00709 #else
00710     llvm::Value *mm1 = LaneMask(v1);
00711     llvm::Value *mm2 = LaneMask(v2);
00712     return CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ, mm1, mm2,
00713                    "v1==v2");
00714 #endif
00715 }
00716 
00717 
00718 llvm::Value *
00719 FunctionEmitContext::GetStringPtr(const std::string &str) {
00720     llvm::Constant *lstr = llvm::ConstantArray::get(*g->ctx, str);
00721     llvm::GlobalValue::LinkageTypes linkage = llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage;
00722     llvm::Value *lstrPtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, lstr->getType(),
00723                                                     true /*isConst*/, 
00724                                                     linkage, lstr, "__str");
00725     return new llvm::BitCastInst(lstrPtr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 
00726                                  "str_void_ptr", bblock);
00727 }
00728 
00729 
00730 llvm::BasicBlock *
00731 FunctionEmitContext::CreateBasicBlock(const char *name) {
00732     llvm::Function *function = bblock->getParent();
00733     return llvm::BasicBlock::Create(*g->ctx, name, function);
00734 }
00735 
00736 
00737 llvm::Value *
00738 FunctionEmitContext::I1VecToBoolVec(llvm::Value *b) {
00739     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
00740         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(b->getType());
00741     if (at) {
00742         // If we're given an array of vectors of i1s, then do the
00743         // conversion for each of the elements
00744         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *boolArrayType = 
00745             llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType, at->getNumElements());
00746         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(boolArrayType);
00747 
00748         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < at->getNumElements(); ++i) {
00749             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(b, i);
00750             llvm::Value *sext = SExtInst(elt, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType, 
00751                                          "val_to_boolvec32");
00752             ret = InsertInst(ret, sext, i);
00753         }
00754         return ret;
00755     }
00756     else
00757         return SExtInst(b, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType, "val_to_boolvec32");
00758 }
00759 
00760 
00761 llvm::Value *
00762 FunctionEmitContext::EmitMalloc(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ty, int align) {
00763     // Emit code to compute the size of the given type using a GEP with a
00764     // NULL base pointer, indexing one element of the given type, and
00765     // casting the resulting 'pointer' to an int giving its size.
00766     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptrType = llvm::PointerType::get(ty, 0);
00767     llvm::Value *nullPtr = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(ptrType);
00768     llvm::Value *index[1] = { LLVMInt32(1) };
00769 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00770     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&index[0], &index[1]);
00771     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, arrayRef,
00772                                                            "offset_ptr", bblock);
00773 #else
00774     llvm::Value *poffset = llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(nullPtr, &index[0], &index[1],
00775                                                            "offset_ptr", bblock);
00776 #endif
00777     AddDebugPos(poffset);
00778     llvm::Value *sizeOf = PtrToIntInst(poffset, LLVMTypes::Int64Type, "offset_int");
00779 
00780     // And given the size, call the malloc function
00781     llvm::Function *fmalloc = m->module->getFunction("ISPCMalloc");
00782     assert(fmalloc != NULL);
00783     llvm::Value *mem = CallInst(fmalloc, sizeOf, LLVMInt32(align), 
00784                                 "raw_argmem");
00785     // Cast the void * back to the result pointer type
00786     return BitCastInst(mem, ptrType, "mem_bitcast");
00787 }
00788 
00789 
00790 void
00791 FunctionEmitContext::EmitFree(llvm::Value *ptr) {
00792     llvm::Value *freeArg = BitCastInst(ptr, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType,
00793                                        "argmemfree");
00794     llvm::Function *ffree = m->module->getFunction("ISPCFree");
00795     assert(ffree != NULL);
00796     CallInst(ffree, freeArg);
00797 }
00798 
00799 
00800 static llvm::Value *
00801 lGetStringAsValue(llvm::BasicBlock *bblock, const char *s) {
00802     llvm::Constant *sConstant = llvm::ConstantArray::get(*g->ctx, s);
00803     llvm::Value *sPtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, sConstant->getType(), 
00804                                                  true /* const */,
00805                                                  llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
00806                                                  sConstant, s);
00807     llvm::Value *indices[2] = { LLVMInt32(0), LLVMInt32(0) };
00808 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
00809     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&indices[0], &indices[2]);
00810     return llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(sPtr, arrayRef, "sptr", bblock);
00811 #else
00812     return llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(sPtr, &indices[0], &indices[2],
00813                                            "sptr", bblock);
00814 #endif
00815 }
00816 
00817 
00818 void
00819 FunctionEmitContext::AddInstrumentationPoint(const char *note) {
00820     assert(note != NULL);
00821     if (!g->emitInstrumentation)
00822         return;
00823 
00824     std::vector<llvm::Value *> args;
00825     // arg 1: filename as string
00826     args.push_back(lGetStringAsValue(bblock, currentPos.name));
00827     // arg 2: provided note
00828     args.push_back(lGetStringAsValue(bblock, note));
00829     // arg 3: line number
00830     args.push_back(LLVMInt32(currentPos.first_line));
00831     // arg 4: current mask, movmsk'ed down to an int32
00832     args.push_back(LaneMask(GetMask()));
00833 
00834     llvm::Function *finst = m->module->getFunction("ISPCInstrument");
00835     CallInst(finst, args, "");
00836 }
00837 
00838 
00839 void
00840 FunctionEmitContext::SetDebugPos(SourcePos pos) { 
00841     currentPos = pos; 
00842 }
00843 
00844 
00845 SourcePos
00846 FunctionEmitContext::GetDebugPos() const {
00847     return currentPos;
00848 }
00849 
00850 
00851 void
00852 FunctionEmitContext::AddDebugPos(llvm::Value *value, const SourcePos *pos, 
00853                                  llvm::DIScope *scope) {
00854     llvm::Instruction *inst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::Instruction>(value);
00855     if (inst != NULL && m->diBuilder) {
00856         SourcePos p = pos ? *pos : currentPos;
00857         if (p.first_line != 0)
00858             // If first_line == 0, then we're in the middle of setting up
00859             // the standard library or the like; don't add debug positions
00860             // for those functions
00861             inst->setDebugLoc(llvm::DebugLoc::get(p.first_line, p.first_column, 
00862                                                   scope ? *scope : GetDIScope()));
00863     }
00864 }
00865 
00866 
00867 void
00868 FunctionEmitContext::StartScope() {
00869     if (m->diBuilder != NULL) {
00870         llvm::DIScope parentScope;
00871         if (debugScopes.size() > 0)
00872             parentScope = debugScopes.back();
00873         else
00874             parentScope = diFunction;
00875 
00876         llvm::DILexicalBlock lexicalBlock = 
00877             m->diBuilder->createLexicalBlock(parentScope, diFile,
00878                                              currentPos.first_line,
00879                                              currentPos.first_column);
00880         debugScopes.push_back(lexicalBlock);
00881     }
00882 }
00883 
00884 
00885 void
00886 FunctionEmitContext::EndScope() {
00887     if (m->diBuilder != NULL) {
00888         assert(debugScopes.size() > 0);
00889         debugScopes.pop_back();
00890     }
00891 }
00892 
00893 
00894 llvm::DIScope 
00895 FunctionEmitContext::GetDIScope() const {
00896     assert(debugScopes.size() > 0);
00897     return debugScopes.back();
00898 }
00899 
00900 
00901 void
00902 FunctionEmitContext::EmitVariableDebugInfo(Symbol *sym) {
00903     if (m->diBuilder == NULL)
00904         return;
00905 
00906     llvm::DIScope scope = GetDIScope();
00907     llvm::DIVariable var = 
00908         m->diBuilder->createLocalVariable(llvm::dwarf::DW_TAG_auto_variable,
00909                                           scope,
00910                                           sym->name,
00911                                           sym->pos.GetDIFile(),
00912                                           sym->pos.first_line,
00913                                           sym->type->GetDIType(scope),
00914                                           true /* preserve through opts */);
00915     llvm::Instruction *declareInst = 
00916         m->diBuilder->insertDeclare(sym->storagePtr, var, bblock);
00917     AddDebugPos(declareInst, &sym->pos, &scope);
00918 }
00919 
00920 
00921 void
00922 FunctionEmitContext::EmitFunctionParameterDebugInfo(Symbol *sym) {
00923     if (m->diBuilder == NULL)
00924         return;
00925 
00926     llvm::DIScope scope = diFunction;
00927     llvm::DIVariable var = 
00928         m->diBuilder->createLocalVariable(llvm::dwarf::DW_TAG_arg_variable,
00929                                           scope,
00930                                           sym->name,
00931                                           sym->pos.GetDIFile(),
00932                                           sym->pos.first_line,
00933                                           sym->type->GetDIType(scope),
00934                                           true /* preserve through opts */);
00935     llvm::Instruction *declareInst = 
00936         m->diBuilder->insertDeclare(sym->storagePtr, var, bblock);
00937     AddDebugPos(declareInst, &sym->pos, &scope);
00938 }
00939 
00940 
00941 /** If the given type is an array of vector types, then it's the
00942     representation of an ispc VectorType with varying elements.  If it is
00943     one of these, return the array size (i.e. the VectorType's size).
00944     Otherwise return zero.
00945  */
00946 static int
00947 lArrayVectorWidth(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *t) {
00948     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType = 
00949         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(t);
00950     if (arrayType == NULL)
00951         return 0;
00952 
00953     // We shouldn't be seeing arrays of anything but vectors being passed
00954     // to things like FunctionEmitContext::BinaryOperator() as operands
00955     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorElementType = 
00956         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(arrayType->getElementType());
00957     assert(vectorElementType != NULL &&
00958            (int)vectorElementType->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
00959     return (int)arrayType->getNumElements();
00960 }
00961 
00962 
00963 llvm::Value *
00964 FunctionEmitContext::BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst, 
00965                                     llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1, 
00966                                     const char *name) {
00967     if (v0 == NULL || v1 == NULL) {
00968         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
00969         return NULL;
00970     }
00971 
00972     assert(v0->getType() == v1->getType());
00973     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = v0->getType();
00974     int arraySize = lArrayVectorWidth(type);
00975     if (arraySize == 0) {
00976         llvm::Instruction *bop = 
00977             llvm::BinaryOperator::Create(inst, v0, v1, name ? name : "", bblock);
00978         AddDebugPos(bop);
00979         return bop;
00980     }
00981     else {
00982         // If this is an ispc VectorType, apply the binary operator to each
00983         // of the elements of the array (which in turn should be either
00984         // scalar types or llvm::VectorTypes.)
00985         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(type);
00986         for (int i = 0; i < arraySize; ++i) {
00987             llvm::Value *a = ExtractInst(v0, i);
00988             llvm::Value *b = ExtractInst(v1, i);
00989             llvm::Value *op = BinaryOperator(inst, a, b);
00990             ret = InsertInst(ret, op, i);
00991         }
00992         return ret;
00993     }
00994 }
00995 
00996 
00997 llvm::Value *
00998 FunctionEmitContext::NotOperator(llvm::Value *v, const char *name) {
00999     if (v == NULL) {
01000         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01001         return NULL;
01002     }
01003 
01004     // Similarly to BinaryOperator, do the operation on all the elements of
01005     // the array if we're given an array type; otherwise just do the
01006     // regular llvm operation.
01007     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = v->getType();
01008     int arraySize = lArrayVectorWidth(type);
01009     if (arraySize == 0) {
01010         llvm::Instruction *binst = 
01011             llvm::BinaryOperator::CreateNot(v, name ? name : "not", bblock);
01012         AddDebugPos(binst);
01013         return binst;
01014     }
01015     else {
01016         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(type);
01017         for (int i = 0; i < arraySize; ++i) {
01018             llvm::Value *a = ExtractInst(v, i);
01019             llvm::Value *op = 
01020                 llvm::BinaryOperator::CreateNot(a, name ? name : "not", bblock);
01021             AddDebugPos(op);
01022             ret = InsertInst(ret, op, i);
01023         }
01024         return ret;
01025     }
01026 }
01027 
01028 
01029 // Given the llvm Type that represents an ispc VectorType, return an
01030 // equally-shaped type with boolean elements.  (This is the type that will
01031 // be returned from CmpInst with ispc VectorTypes).
01032 static LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
01033 lGetMatchingBoolVectorType(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type) {
01034     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType = 
01035         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(type);
01036     // should only be called for vector typed stuff...
01037     assert(arrayType != NULL);
01038 
01039     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *vectorElementType =
01040         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(arrayType->getElementType());
01041     assert(vectorElementType != NULL &&
01042            (int)vectorElementType->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01043 
01044     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *base = 
01045         llvm::VectorType::get(LLVMTypes::BoolType, g->target.vectorWidth);
01046     return llvm::ArrayType::get(base, arrayType->getNumElements());
01047 }
01048 
01049 
01050 llvm::Value *
01051 FunctionEmitContext::CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::OtherOps inst, 
01052                              llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred,
01053                              llvm::Value *v0, llvm::Value *v1, 
01054                              const char *name) {
01055     if (v0 == NULL || v1 == NULL) {
01056         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01057         return NULL;
01058     }
01059 
01060     assert(v0->getType() == v1->getType());
01061     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = v0->getType();
01062     int arraySize = lArrayVectorWidth(type);
01063     if (arraySize == 0) {
01064         llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01065             llvm::CmpInst::Create(inst, pred, v0, v1, name ? name : "cmp", 
01066                                   bblock);
01067         AddDebugPos(ci);
01068         return ci;
01069     }
01070     else {
01071         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *boolType = lGetMatchingBoolVectorType(type);
01072         llvm::Value *ret = llvm::UndefValue::get(boolType);
01073         for (int i = 0; i < arraySize; ++i) {
01074             llvm::Value *a = ExtractInst(v0, i);
01075             llvm::Value *b = ExtractInst(v1, i);
01076             llvm::Value *op = CmpInst(inst, pred, a, b, name);
01077             ret = InsertInst(ret, op, i);
01078         }
01079         return ret;
01080     }
01081 }
01082 
01083 
01084 llvm::Value *
01085 FunctionEmitContext::BitCastInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type, 
01086                                  const char *name) {
01087     if (value == NULL) {
01088         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01089         return NULL;
01090     }
01091 
01092     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *valType = value->getType();
01093     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
01094         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(valType);
01095     if (at && llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(at->getElementType())) {
01096         // If we're bitcasting an array of pointers, we have a varying
01097         // lvalue; apply the corresponding bitcast to each of the
01098         // individual pointers and return the result array.
01099         assert((int)at->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01100 
01101         llvm::Value *ret = 
01102             llvm::UndefValue::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(type, g->target.vectorWidth));
01103         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01104             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(value, i);
01105             llvm::Value *bc = BitCastInst(elt, type, name);
01106             ret = InsertInst(ret, bc, i);
01107         }
01108         return ret;
01109     }
01110     else {
01111         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01112             new llvm::BitCastInst(value, type, name ? name : "bitcast", bblock);
01113         AddDebugPos(inst);
01114         return inst;
01115     }
01116 }
01117 
01118 
01119 llvm::Value *
01120 FunctionEmitContext::PtrToIntInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type,
01121                                   const char *name) {
01122     if (value == NULL) {
01123         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01124         return NULL;
01125     }
01126 
01127     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *valType = value->getType();
01128     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
01129         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(valType);
01130     if (at && llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(at->getElementType())) {
01131         // varying lvalue -> apply ptr to int to the individual pointers
01132         assert((int)at->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01133 
01134         llvm::Value *ret = 
01135             llvm::UndefValue::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(type, g->target.vectorWidth));
01136         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01137             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(value, i);
01138             llvm::Value *p2i = PtrToIntInst(elt, type, name);
01139             ret = InsertInst(ret, p2i, i);
01140         }
01141         return ret;
01142     }
01143     else {
01144         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01145             new llvm::PtrToIntInst(value, type, name ? name : "ptr2int", bblock);
01146         AddDebugPos(inst);
01147         return inst;
01148     }
01149 }
01150 
01151 
01152 llvm::Value *
01153 FunctionEmitContext::IntToPtrInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type,
01154                                   const char *name) {
01155     if (value == NULL) {
01156         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01157         return NULL;
01158     }
01159 
01160     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *valType = value->getType();
01161     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *at = 
01162         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(valType);
01163     if (at && llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(at->getElementType())) {
01164         // varying lvalue -> apply int to ptr to the individual pointers
01165         assert((int)at->getNumElements() == g->target.vectorWidth);
01166 
01167         llvm::Value *ret = 
01168             llvm::UndefValue::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(type, g->target.vectorWidth));
01169         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01170             llvm::Value *elt = ExtractInst(value, i);
01171             llvm::Value *i2p = IntToPtrInst(elt, type, name);
01172             ret = InsertInst(ret, i2p, i);
01173         }
01174         return ret;
01175     }
01176     else {
01177         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01178             new llvm::IntToPtrInst(value, type, name ? name : "int2ptr", bblock);
01179         AddDebugPos(inst);
01180         return inst;
01181     }
01182 }
01183 
01184 
01185 llvm::Instruction *
01186 FunctionEmitContext::TruncInst(llvm::Value *value, LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type,
01187                                const char *name) {
01188     if (value == NULL) {
01189         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01190         return NULL;
01191     }
01192 
01193     // TODO: we should probably handle the array case as in
01194     // e.g. BitCastInst(), but we don't currently need that functionality
01195     llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01196         new llvm::TruncInst(value, type, name ? name : "trunc", bblock);
01197     AddDebugPos(inst);
01198     return inst;
01199 }

01211     // e.g. BitCastInst(), but we don't currently need that functionality
01212     llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01213         llvm::CastInst::Create(op, value, type, name ? name : "cast", bblock);
01214     AddDebugPos(inst);
01215     return inst;

01224         return NULL;

01268 
01269 
01270 llvm::Value *
01271 FunctionEmitContext::GetElementPtrInst(llvm::Value *basePtr, llvm::Value *index0, 
01272                                        llvm::Value *index1, const char *name) {
01273     if (basePtr == NULL || index0 == NULL || index1 == NULL) {
01274         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01275         return NULL;
01276     }
01277 
01278     // FIXME: do we need need to handle the case of the first index being
01279     // varying?  It's currently needed...
01280     assert(!llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(index0->getType()));
01281 
01282     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *basePtrType = basePtr->getType();
01283     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *baseArrayType = 
01284         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(basePtrType);
01285     bool baseIsVaryingTypePointer = (baseArrayType != NULL) && 
01286         llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(baseArrayType->getElementType());
01287     bool indexIsVaryingType = 
01288         llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(index1->getType());
01289 
01290     if (!indexIsVaryingType && !baseIsVaryingTypePointer) {
01291         // The easy case: both the base pointer and the indices are
01292         // uniform, so just emit the regular LLVM GEP instruction
01293         llvm::Value *indices[2] = { index0, index1 };
01294 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01295         llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> arrayRef(&indices[0], &indices[2]);
01296         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01297             llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basePtr, arrayRef,
01298                                             name ? name : "gep", bblock);
01299 #else
01300         llvm::Instruction *inst = 
01301             llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basePtr, &indices[0], &indices[2], 
01302                                             name ? name : "gep", bblock);
01303 #endif
01304         AddDebugPos(inst);
01305         return inst;
01306     }
01307     else {
01308         // We have a varying pointer and/or indices; emit the appropriate
01309         // GEP for each of the program instances
01310         llvm::Value *lret = NULL;
01311         for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01312             // Get the index, either using the same one if it's uniform or
01313             // the one for this lane if it's varying
01314             llvm::Value *indexElt;
01315             if (indexIsVaryingType)
01316                 indexElt = ExtractInst(index1, i, "get_array_index");
01317             else
01318                 indexElt = index1;
01319 
01320             // Similarly figure out the appropriate base pointer
01321             llvm::Value *aptr;
01322             if (baseIsVaryingTypePointer)
01323                 aptr = ExtractInst(basePtr, i, "get_array_index");
01324             else
01325                 aptr = basePtr;
01326 
01327             // Do the GEP for this lane
01328             llvm::Value *eltPtr = GetElementPtrInst(aptr, index0, indexElt, name);
01329 
01330             if (lret == NULL) {
01331                 // This is kind of a hack: use the type from the GEP to
01332                 // figure out the return type and the first time through,
01333                 // create an undef value of that type here
01334                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *elementPtrType = 
01335                     llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(eltPtr->getType());
01336                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *elementType = 
01337                     elementPtrType->getElementType();
01338                 lret = llvm::UndefValue::get(LLVMPointerVectorType(elementType));
01339             }
01340 
01341             // And insert the result of the GEP into the return value
01342             lret = InsertInst(lret, eltPtr, i, "elt_ptr_store");
01343         }
01344         return lret;
01345     }
01346 }
01347 
01348 
01349 llvm::Value *
01350 FunctionEmitContext::GetElementPtrInst(llvm::Value *basePtr, int v0, int v1,
01351                                        const char *name) {
01352     return GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, LLVMInt32(v0), LLVMInt32(v1), name);
01353 }
01354     
01355 
01356 llvm::Value *
01357 FunctionEmitContext::LoadInst(llvm::Value *lvalue, const Type *type, 
01358                               const char *name) {
01359     if (lvalue == NULL) {
01360         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01361         return NULL;
01362     }
01363 
01364     if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(lvalue->getType())) {
01365         // If the lvalue is a straight up regular pointer, then just issue
01366         // a regular load.  First figure out the alignment; in general we
01367         // can just assume the natural alignment (0 here), but for varying
01368         // atomic types, we need to make sure that the compiler emits
01369         // unaligned vector loads, so we specify a reduced alignment here.
01370         int align = 0;
01371         const AtomicType *atomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
01372         if (atomicType != NULL && atomicType->IsVaryingType())
01373             // We actually just want to align to the vector element
01374             // alignment, but can't easily get that here, so just tell LLVM
01375             // it's totally unaligned.  (This shouldn't make any difference
01376             // vs the proper alignment in practice.)
01377             align = 1;
01378         llvm::Instruction *inst = new llvm::LoadInst(lvalue, name ? name : "load",
01379                                                      false /* not volatile */,
01380                                                      align, bblock);
01381         AddDebugPos(inst);
01382         return inst;
01383     }
01384     else {
01385         // Otherwise we should have a varying lvalue and it's time for a
01386         // gather.  The "type" parameter only has to be non-NULL for the
01387         // gather path here (we can't reliably figure out all of the type
01388         // information we need from the LLVM::Type, so have to carry the
01389         // ispc type in through this path..
01390         assert(type != NULL);
01391         assert(llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()));
01392         return gather(lvalue, type, name);
01393     }
01394 }
01395 
01396 
01397 llvm::Value *
01398 FunctionEmitContext::gather(llvm::Value *lvalue, const Type *type, 
01399                             const char *name) {
01400     // We should have a varying lvalue if we get here...
01401     assert(llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()));
01402 
01403     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *retType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01404 
01405     const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type);
01406     if (st) {
01407         // If we're gathering structures, do an element-wise gather
01408         // recursively.
01409         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(retType);
01410         for (int i = 0; i < st->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01411             llvm::Value *eltPtrs = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01412             // This in turn will be another gather
01413             llvm::Value *eltValues = LoadInst(eltPtrs, st->GetElementType(i), 
01414                                               name);
01415             retValue = InsertInst(retValue, eltValues, i, "set_value");
01416         }
01417         return retValue;
01418     }
01419 
01420     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
01421     if (vt) {
01422         // Similarly, if it's a vector type, do a gather for each of the
01423         // vector elements
01424         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(retType);
01425         // FIXME: yuck.  Change lvalues to be pointers to arrays so that
01426         // the GEP stuff in the loop below ends up computing pointers based
01427         // on elements in the vectors rather than incorrectly advancing to
01428         // the next vector...
01429         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *eltType = 
01430             vt->GetBaseType()->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01431         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(eltType, 0), 0));
01432 
01433         for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01434             llvm::Value *eltPtrs = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01435             llvm::Value *eltValues = LoadInst(eltPtrs, vt->GetBaseType(), name);
01436             retValue = InsertInst(retValue, eltValues, i, "set_value");
01437         }
01438         return retValue;
01439     }
01440 
01441     const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
01442     if (at) {
01443         // Arrays are also handled recursively and element-wise
01444         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(retType);
01445         for (int i = 0; i < at->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01446             llvm::Value *eltPtrs = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01447             llvm::Value *eltValues = LoadInst(eltPtrs, at->GetElementType(), name);
01448             retValue = InsertInst(retValue, eltValues, i, "set_value");
01449         }
01450         return retValue;
01451     }
01452 
01453     // Otherwise we should just have a basic scalar type and we can go and
01454     // do the actual gather
01455     AddInstrumentationPoint("gather");
01456 
01457     llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
01458     llvm::Function *gather = NULL;
01459     // Figure out which gather function to call based on the size of
01460     // the elements.
01461     if (retType == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType || 
01462         retType == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType)
01463         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_64");
01464     else if (retType == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType || 
01465              retType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
01466         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_32");
01467     else if (retType == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType)
01468         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_16");
01469     else {
01470         assert(retType == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType);
01471         gather = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_8");
01472     }
01473     assert(gather != NULL);
01474 
01475     llvm::Value *voidlvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01476     llvm::Instruction *call = CallInst(gather, voidlvalue, mask, name);
01477     // Add metadata about the source file location so that the
01478     // optimization passes can print useful performance warnings if we
01479     // can't optimize out this gather
01480     addGSMetadata(call, currentPos);
01481 
01482     llvm::Value *val = BitCastInst(call, retType, "gather_bitcast");
01483 
01484     return val;
01485 }
01486 
01487 
01488 /** Add metadata to the given instruction to encode the current source file
01489     position.  This data is used in the lGetSourcePosFromMetadata()
01490     function in opt.cpp. 
01491 */
01492 void
01493 FunctionEmitContext::addGSMetadata(llvm::Instruction *inst, SourcePos pos) {
01494     llvm::Value *str = llvm::MDString::get(*g->ctx, pos.name);
01495     llvm::MDNode *md = llvm::MDNode::get(*g->ctx, str);
01496     inst->setMetadata("filename", md);
01497 
01498     llvm::Value *line = LLVMInt32(pos.first_line);
01499     md = llvm::MDNode::get(*g->ctx, line);
01500     inst->setMetadata("line", md);
01501 
01502     llvm::Value *column = LLVMInt32(pos.first_column);
01503     md = llvm::MDNode::get(*g->ctx, column);
01504     inst->setMetadata("column", md);
01505 }
01506 
01507 
01508 llvm::Value *
01509 FunctionEmitContext::AllocaInst(LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType, const char *name,
01510                                 int align, bool atEntryBlock) {
01511     llvm::AllocaInst *inst = NULL;
01512     if (atEntryBlock) {
01513         // We usually insert it right before the jump instruction at the
01514         // end of allocaBlock
01515         llvm::Instruction *retInst = allocaBlock->getTerminator();
01516         assert(retInst);
01517         inst = new llvm::AllocaInst(llvmType, name ? name : "", retInst);
01518     }
01519     else
01520         // Unless the caller overrode the default and wants it in the
01521         // current basic block
01522         inst = new llvm::AllocaInst(llvmType, name ? name : "", bblock);
01523 
01524     // If no alignment was specified but we have an array of a uniform
01525     // type, then align it to 4 * the native vector width; it's not
01526     // unlikely that this array will be loaded into varying variables with
01527     // what will be aligned accesses if the uniform -> varying load is done
01528     // in regular chunks.
01529     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *arrayType = 
01530         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(llvmType);
01531     if (align == 0 && arrayType != NULL && 
01532         !llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(arrayType->getElementType()))
01533         align = 4 * g->target.nativeVectorWidth;
01534 
01535     if (align != 0)
01536         inst->setAlignment(align);
01537     // Don't add debugging info to alloca instructions
01538     return inst;
01539 }
01540 
01541 
01542 /** Code to store the given varying value to the given location, only
01543     storing the elements that correspond to active program instances as
01544     given by the provided storeMask value.  Note that the lvalue is only a
01545     single pointer, not a varying lvalue of one pointer per program
01546     instance (that case is handled by scatters).
01547  */
01548 void
01549 FunctionEmitContext::maskedStore(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
01550                                  const Type *rvalueType, 
01551                                  llvm::Value *storeMask) {
01552     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) {
01553         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01554         return;
01555     }
01556 
01557     assert(llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(lvalue->getType()));
01558     
01559     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
01560         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(rvalueType);
01561     if (collectionType != NULL) {
01562         // Assigning a structure / array / vector. Handle each element
01563         // individually with what turns into a recursive call to
01564         // makedStore()
01565         for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01566             llvm::Value *eltValue = ExtractInst(rvalue, i, "rvalue_member");
01567             llvm::Value *eltLValue = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i, 
01568                                                        "struct_lvalue_ptr");
01569             StoreInst(eltValue, eltLValue, storeMask, 
01570                       collectionType->GetElementType(i));
01571         }
01572         return;
01573     }
01574 
01575     // We must have a regular atomic or enumerator type at this point
01576     assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(rvalueType) != NULL ||
01577            dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(rvalueType) != NULL);
01578     rvalueType = rvalueType->GetAsNonConstType();
01579 
01580     llvm::Function *maskedStoreFunc = NULL;
01581     // Figure out if we need a 8, 16, 32 or 64-bit masked store.
01582     if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingDouble || 
01583         rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt64 ||
01584         rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) {
01585         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_64");
01586         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int64VectorPointerType, 
01587                              "lvalue_to_int64vecptr");
01588         rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType, 
01589                              "rvalue_to_int64");
01590     }
01591     else if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingFloat ||
01592              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingBool ||
01593              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt32 ||
01594              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
01595              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(rvalueType) != NULL) {
01596         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_32");
01597         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType, 
01598                              "lvalue_to_int32vecptr");
01599         if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingFloat)
01600             rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType, 
01601                                  "rvalue_to_int32");
01602     }
01603     else if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt16 ||
01604              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt16) {
01605         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_16");
01606         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int16VectorPointerType, 
01607                              "lvalue_to_int16vecptr");
01608     }
01609     else if (rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingInt8 ||
01610              rvalueType == AtomicType::VaryingUInt8) {
01611         maskedStoreFunc = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_masked_store_8");
01612         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::Int8VectorPointerType, 
01613                              "lvalue_to_int8vecptr");
01614     }
01615 
01616     std::vector<llvm::Value *> args;
01617     args.push_back(lvalue);
01618     args.push_back(rvalue);
01619     args.push_back(storeMask);
01620     CallInst(maskedStoreFunc, args);
01621 }
01622 
01623 
01624 
01625 /** Scatter the given varying value to the locations given by the varying
01626     lvalue (which should be an array of pointers with size equal to the
01627     target's vector width.  We want to store each rvalue element at the
01628     corresponding pointer's location, *if* the mask for the corresponding
01629     program instance are on.  If they're off, don't do anything.  
01630 */
01631 void
01632 FunctionEmitContext::scatter(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue, 
01633                              llvm::Value *storeMask, const Type *rvalueType) {
01634     assert(rvalueType->IsVaryingType());
01635     assert(llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()));
01636 
01637     const StructType *structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(rvalueType);
01638     if (structType) {
01639         // Scatter the struct elements individually
01640         for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01641             llvm::Value *lv = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01642             llvm::Value *rv = ExtractInst(rvalue, i);
01643             scatter(rv, lv, storeMask, structType->GetElementType(i));
01644         }
01645         return;
01646     }
01647 
01648     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(rvalueType);
01649     if (vt) {
01650         // FIXME: yuck.  Change lvalues to be pointers to arrays so that
01651         // the GEP stuff in the loop below ends up computing pointers based
01652         // on elements in the vectors rather than incorrectly advancing to
01653         // the next vector...
01654         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *eltType = 
01655             vt->GetBaseType()->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01656         lvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::ArrayType::get(eltType, 0), 0));
01657 
01658         for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01659             llvm::Value *lv = GetElementPtrInst(lvalue, 0, i);
01660             llvm::Value *rv = ExtractInst(rvalue, i);
01661             scatter(rv, lv, storeMask, vt->GetElementType());
01662         }
01663         return;
01664     }
01665 
01666     // I think this should be impossible
01667     assert(dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(rvalueType) == NULL);
01668 
01669     // And everything should be atomic from here on out...
01670     assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(rvalueType) != NULL);
01671 
01672     llvm::Function *func = NULL;
01673     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *type = rvalue->getType();
01674     if (type == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType || 
01675         type == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType) {
01676         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_64");
01677         rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType, "rvalue2int");
01678     }
01679     else if (type == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType || 
01680              type == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
01681         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_32");
01682         rvalue = BitCastInst(rvalue, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType, "rvalue2int");
01683     }
01684     else if (type == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType)
01685         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_16");
01686     else if (type == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType)
01687         func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_8");
01688     assert(func != NULL);
01689     
01690     AddInstrumentationPoint("scatter");
01691 
01692     llvm::Value *voidlvalue = BitCastInst(lvalue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01693     std::vector<llvm::Value *> args;
01694     args.push_back(voidlvalue);
01695     args.push_back(rvalue);
01696     args.push_back(storeMask);
01697     llvm::Instruction *inst = CallInst(func, args);
01698     addGSMetadata(inst, currentPos);
01699 }
01700 
01701 
01702 void
01703 FunctionEmitContext::StoreInst(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
01704                                const char *name) {
01705     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) {
01706         // may happen due to error elsewhere
01707         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01708         return;
01709     }
01710 
01711     llvm::Instruction *inst;
01712     if (llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(rvalue->getType()))
01713         // Specify an unaligned store, since we don't know that the lvalue
01714         // will in fact be aligned to a vector width here.  (Actually
01715         // should be aligned to the alignment of the vector elment type...)
01716         inst = new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, false /* not volatile */,
01717                                    1, bblock);
01718     else
01719         inst = new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, bblock);
01720 
01721     AddDebugPos(inst);
01722 }
01723 
01724 
01725 void
01726 FunctionEmitContext::StoreInst(llvm::Value *rvalue, llvm::Value *lvalue,
01727                                llvm::Value *storeMask, const Type *rvalueType,
01728                                const char *name) {
01729     if (rvalue == NULL || lvalue == NULL) {
01730         // may happen due to error elsewhere
01731         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01732         return;
01733     }
01734 
01735     // Figure out what kind of store we're doing here
01736     if (rvalueType->IsUniformType()) {
01737         // The easy case; a regular store, natural alignment is fine
01738         llvm::Instruction *si = new llvm::StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, bblock);
01739         AddDebugPos(si);
01740     }
01741     else if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lvalue->getType()))
01742         // We have a varying lvalue (an array of pointers), so it's time to
01743         // scatter
01744         scatter(rvalue, lvalue, storeMask, rvalueType);
01745     else if (storeMask == LLVMMaskAllOn) {
01746         // Otherwise it is a masked store unless we can determine that the
01747         // mask is all on...
01748         StoreInst(rvalue, lvalue, name);
01749     }
01750     else
01751         maskedStore(rvalue, lvalue, rvalueType, storeMask);
01752 }
01753 
01754 
01755 void
01756 FunctionEmitContext::BranchInst(llvm::BasicBlock *dest) {
01757     llvm::Instruction *b = llvm::BranchInst::Create(dest, bblock);
01758     AddDebugPos(b);
01759 }

01762 void
01763 FunctionEmitContext::BranchInst(llvm::BasicBlock *trueBlock, 
01764                                 llvm::BasicBlock *falseBlock,
01765                                 llvm::Value *test) {
01766     if (test == NULL) {
01767         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01768         return;
01769     }
01770 
01771     llvm::Instruction *b = 
01772         llvm::BranchInst::Create(trueBlock, falseBlock, test, bblock);
01773     AddDebugPos(b);
01774 }

01776 
01777 llvm::Value *
01778 FunctionEmitContext::ExtractInst(llvm::Value *v, int elt, const char *name) {
01779     if (v == NULL) {
01780         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01781         return NULL;
01782     }
01783 
01784     llvm::Instruction *ei = NULL;
01785     if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(v->getType()))
01786         ei = llvm::ExtractElementInst::Create(v, LLVMInt32(elt), 
01787                                               name ? name : "extract", bblock);
01788     else
01789         ei = llvm::ExtractValueInst::Create(v, elt, name ? name : "extract",
01790                                             bblock);
01791     AddDebugPos(ei);
01792     return ei;
01793 }

01796 llvm::Value *
01797 FunctionEmitContext::InsertInst(llvm::Value *v, llvm::Value *eltVal, int elt, 
01798                                 const char *name) {
01799     if (v == NULL || eltVal == NULL) {
01800         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01801         return NULL;
01802     }
01803 
01804     llvm::Instruction *ii = NULL;
01805     if (llvm::isa<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(v->getType()))
01806         ii = llvm::InsertElementInst::Create(v, eltVal, LLVMInt32(elt), 
01807                                              name ? name : "insert", bblock);
01808     else
01809         ii = llvm::InsertValueInst::Create(v, eltVal, elt, 
01810                                            name ? name : "insert", bblock);
01811     AddDebugPos(ii);
01812     return ii;
01813 }

01819     llvm::PHINode *pn = llvm::PHINode::Create(type, 
01820 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01821                                               count, 
01822 #endif // LLVM_3_0
01823                                               name ? name : "phi", bblock);
01824     AddDebugPos(pn);
01825     return pn;

01845 llvm::Instruction *
01846 FunctionEmitContext::CallInst(llvm::Function *func, 
01847                               const std::vector<llvm::Value *> &args,
01848                               const char *name) {
01849     if (func == NULL) {
01850         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01851         return NULL;
01852     }
01853 
01854 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01855     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01856         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, args, name ? name : "", bblock);
01857 #else
01858     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01859         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, args.begin(), args.end(), 
01860                                name ? name : "", bblock);
01861 #endif
01862     AddDebugPos(ci);
01863     return ci;
01864 }

01867 llvm::Instruction *
01868 FunctionEmitContext::CallInst(llvm::Function *func, llvm::Value *arg, 
01869                               const char *name) {
01870     if (func == NULL || arg == NULL) {
01871         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01872         return NULL;
01873     }
01874 
01875 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01876     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01877         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, arg, name ? name : "", bblock);
01878 #else
01879     llvm::Value *args[] = { arg };
01880     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01881         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, &args[0], &args[1], name ? name : "",
01882                                bblock);
01883 #endif
01884     AddDebugPos(ci);
01885     return ci;
01886 }
