01888 
01889 llvm::Instruction *
01890 FunctionEmitContext::CallInst(llvm::Function *func, llvm::Value *arg0,
01891                               llvm::Value *arg1, const char *name) {
01892     if (func == NULL || arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL) {
01893         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01894         return NULL;
01895     }
01896 
01897     llvm::Value *args[] = { arg0, arg1 };
01898 #if defined(LLVM_3_0) || defined(LLVM_3_0svn)
01899     llvm::ArrayRef<llvm::Value *> argArrayRef(&args[0], &args[2]);
01900     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01901         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, argArrayRef, name ? name : "", 
01902                                bblock);
01903 #else
01904     llvm::Instruction *ci = 
01905         llvm::CallInst::Create(func, &args[0], &args[2], name ? name : "", 
01906                                bblock);
01907 #endif
01908     AddDebugPos(ci);
01909     return ci;
01910 }
01911 
01912 
01913 llvm::Instruction *
01914 FunctionEmitContext::ReturnInst() {
01915     if (launchedTasks) {
01916         // Automatically add a sync call at the end of any function that
01917         // launched tasks
01918         SourcePos noPos;
01919         noPos.name = "__auto_sync";
01920         ExprStmt *es = new ExprStmt(new SyncExpr(noPos), noPos);
01921         es->EmitCode(this); 
01922         delete es;
01923     }
01924 
01925     llvm::Instruction *rinst = NULL;
01926     if (returnValuePtr != NULL) {
01927         // We have value(s) to return; load them from their storage
01928         // location
01929         llvm::Value *retVal = LoadInst(returnValuePtr, returnType,
01930                                        "return_value");
01931         rinst = llvm::ReturnInst::Create(*g->ctx, retVal, bblock);
01932     }
01933     else {
01934         assert(returnType == AtomicType::Void);
01935         rinst = llvm::ReturnInst::Create(*g->ctx, bblock);
01936     }
01937 
01938     AddDebugPos(rinst);
01939     bblock = NULL;
01940     return rinst;
01941 }
01942 
01943 
01944 llvm::Instruction *
01945 FunctionEmitContext::LaunchInst(llvm::Function *callee, 
01946                                 std::vector<llvm::Value *> &argVals) {
01947     if (callee == NULL) {
01948         assert(m->errorCount > 0);
01949         return NULL;
01950     }
01951 
01952     launchedTasks = true;
01953 
01954     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *argType = callee->arg_begin()->getType();
01955     assert(llvm::PointerType::classof(argType));
01956     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *pt = 
01957         llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(argType);
01958     assert(llvm::StructType::classof(pt->getElementType()));
01959     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::StructType *argStructType = 
01960         static_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::StructType *>(pt->getElementType());
01961     assert(argStructType->getNumElements() == argVals.size() + 1);
01962 
01963     int align = 4 * RoundUpPow2(g->target.nativeVectorWidth);
01964     llvm::Value *argmem;
01965 #ifdef ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
01966     // Use malloc() to allocate storage on Windows, since the stack is
01967     // generally not big enough there to do enough allocations for lots of
01968     // tasks and then things crash horribly...
01969     argmem = EmitMalloc(argStructType, align);
01970 #else
01971     // Otherwise, use alloca for space for the task args, ** unless we're 
01972     // compiling to AVX, in which case we use malloc after all **. (See
01973     // http://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=10841 for details.  There are
01974     // limitations in LLVM with respect to dynamic allocas of this sort
01975     // when the stack also has to be 32-byte aligned...).
01976     if (g->target.isa == Target::AVX)
01977         argmem = EmitMalloc(argStructType, align);
01978     else
01979         // KEY DETAIL: pass false to the call of
01980         // FunctionEmitContext::AllocaInst so that the alloca doesn't
01981         // happen just once at the top of the function, but happens each
01982         // time the enclosing basic block executes.
01983         argmem = AllocaInst(argStructType, "argmem", align, false);
01984 #endif // ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
01985     llvm::Value *voidmem = BitCastInst(argmem, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
01986 
01987     // Copy the values of the parameters into the appropriate place in
01988     // the argument block
01989     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argVals.size(); ++i) {
01990         llvm::Value *ptr = GetElementPtrInst(argmem, 0, i, "funarg");
01991         // don't need to do masked store here, I think
01992         StoreInst(argVals[i], ptr);
01993     }
01994 
01995     // copy in the mask
01996     llvm::Value *mask = GetMask();
01997     llvm::Value *ptr = GetElementPtrInst(argmem, 0, argVals.size(),
01998                                          "funarg_mask");
01999     StoreInst(mask, ptr);
02000 
02001     // And emit the call to the user-supplied task launch function, passing
02002     // a pointer to the task function being called and a pointer to the
02003     // argument block we just filled in
02004     llvm::Value *fptr = BitCastInst(callee, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
02005     llvm::Function *flaunch = m->module->getFunction("ISPCLaunch");
02006     assert(flaunch != NULL);
02007     return CallInst(flaunch, fptr, voidmem, "");
02008 }
